text: The Most RevDespite his title he is not an Archbishop but by tradition the Premier Bishop of Ireland > Debrett’s Correct Form Montague-Smith,P(Ed): London, Debrett’s,1992 Charles Parsons Reichel, DD, MA was an Anglican Bishop and author Amongst others he wrote "Sermons on the Prayer Book", 1857, "Tracts on the Ordinal ", 1872 and "The origins of Christianity", 1882 > British Library web site accessed 12:18 GMT Thursday 15 April 2010 in the 19th century."A New History of Ireland" Moody,T.M;Martin,F.X;Byrne,F.J;Cosgrove,F:By Theodore William Moody, Francis X. Martin, Francis John Byrne, Art Cosgrove: Oxford, Oxford University Press, 1976 He was born in 1816,A History of Pudsey educated at Trinity College, Dublin and ordained in 1847.”The Clergy List” London, Hamilton & Co 1889 After a curacy at St. Mary's Church, Dublin he was Professor of Latin at Queen's College, Belfast "History of the Diocese of Meath" Healy,J:Dublin, Association for promoting Christian Knowledge, 1908 from 1850 to 1864. A son, Sir Harry Reichel, was the first Principal of the University College of North Wales, Bangor, and a Vice-Chancellor of the University of Wales. During his career he held incumbencies at Trim, Mullingar and Clonmacnoise. He was Archdeacon of Meath from 1875 to 1882; ""Fifty years of disestablishment" Patton, H.E. p338: Dublin; Association Promoting Christian Knowledge; 1922Dean of Clonmacnoise from 1882 to 1885 before being consecrated Bishop of Meath in 1885, a position he held until his death on 29 March 1894.Obituary The Bishop Of Meath The Times Friday, 30 March 1894; pg. 8; Issue 34225; col A ==Notes== Category:1816 births Category:1894 deaths Category:People from Pudsey Category:Alumni of Trinity College Dublin Category:Academics of Queen's University Belfast Category:Church of Ireland priests Category:19th-century Anglican bishops Category:Anglican bishops of Meath Category:Deans of Clonmacnoise Category:19th-century Irish Anglican priests
title: Charles Reichel
